Heh, fair. I wouldn't want to listen to myself complain either.
Pretty night, huh?
Look at him, even in his sleep, he's still on the move.
It's actually pretty normal. Cetaceans aren't usually ever
, since half of their brain remains awake while the other half rests.
This allows them to continue to provide motor functions without thinking.
Ya know, so they don't drown.
So he's always on the move. Kinda... like me I guess.
But if I can ask, what was it like for you? When you decided to leave and fill your grandfather's shoes?
A bit scary, but I don't regret it.
Honestly, I don't really think about it much.
Liberating.
Aye, I'd imagine. It's a lot... quieter out here. For better or worse.  But I get it, really. I think about the sea and think the same thing.
Ah, interesting. I suppose it's best not to dwell on the past. Perhaps I should take a page out of your book.
Cheers to that! I might've been a big leap, but I don't think I'd go back, if it were up to me.
There's something about this valley, something I've never really been able to experience.
I think he'll love it here. Cetus, I mean.
He's done so well here, and he seems happier than ever. I'm just a little nervous about how everything will go down.
Well, you don't really think it's all just going to be off without an issue, do you? Not all orcas are the same.
Cetus is a fish-eating orca, and his primary prey consists of salmonids. And orcas of the same diet do pass through these waters, other orcas do as well.
Aye, some hunt seals, sea lions and other marine mammals. And those orcas don't really get along with the fish-eating ones.
Huh? What's that look for? Got seals you've got to worry about? Well don't worry, Cetus won't be any bother to them.
But regardless, Cetus wouldn't be able to join that sort of pod. They just sadly aren't compatible. In fact there's no guarantee that even his own kind will either.
Aye, it's sad. But we have to believe in Cetus. He can't stay here forever.
Even if... we wish he could.
Well. I think that's enough mushy talk for one night, aye?
Thanks for visiting, as always, @.
Night.
Good night, @.
Hey @.
What? So I've gotten pretty good at predicting when you'd appear, so what?
Nice arm. You'd make a great pitcher.
Well, you are pretty easy to predict, too.
Oh, you know it. I got good practice by pitching shots at Joja executives' car windshields.
Strong enough throw to crack the glass, but far enough away for plausible deniability.
Heh, actually, my dad taught me.
He really wanted me to join the local youth baseball team growing up.
The... Southridge Sailfish, I think the name was.
But I never had any interest in sports, really. I only did it because it something to do with my dad, so I never ended up joining. Good team name though.
There's a lot that my parents wanted me to be. Not a whole lot that hope did for them, though.
Ohoho. Following my movements are you?
Drat! I knew I should've been more careful, you're so close to finding out my evil secret.
The secret that, I am in fact... very boring.
I've just got my own little routine. I get things done in the way I need to, and I like it that way.
I'm sure you, as a farmer, understand the need for routine, right?
Actually though, I was kinda hoping you'd show up.
I've just been in a bit of a mood lately. Well, more of a mood than usual.
At this point, I've known you for a while. And I feel that I can confide in you about something.
Would you mind?
I don't think I'm in the best place for that right now.
Not at all! Listening is what I'm good at.
Heh, yeah I guess it is, isn't it? Then I'll just cut to the chase.
I'm sure it's no secret that I'm no the most socially adept person.
But, the truth is, I've really only ever gotten anywhere by losing people.
Often times its not my fault. A lot of the time it is.
With my parents, it was that I just never did what they wanted.
They wanted an all star baseball champion son, but they got boy in love with sea instead.
They wanted a popular kid with loads of friends, but got a nerd who's best friend was living in a big concrete fish bowl.
They wanted a boy who'd bring a girl home, and give them grandkids some day. But all they got was a kid who wanted to be alone.
They would never support my dreams, so I didn't bother sticking around.
That was a good idea, ultimately. Probably just as good for them, too.
I was on my own for a while, before my aunt took me in. She got me into college, and I spent my first 2 years there, with her help.
She worked 2 jobs, and still managed to live for herself and support me with tuition. A real hero, that one.
I wanted to give back, but I had nothing.
And yet she told me everything was alright, that I had nothing to worry about.
I did, foolishly.
I sure am naive, aren't I?
My friend, you don't know the half of it.
I know drunk people aren't always themselves...
But sometimes you just hear people say things, even things they don't mean, and you can't unhear them.
So, I ran away. Again.
After all what's one more torn bond?
And now... it's Cetus who's leaving me.
But obviously, this is what's best. It's what we've worked so hard to achieve.
And now that we're here, I... I'm just scared.
Once he's left, I'll have no reason to stay.
I love this valley, but I was never sent here to stay permanently.
Just more ties to break. Pretty soon, I'll be left with nobody.
And that loneliness, that uncertainty of the future. It's terrifying in a way I don't have words for.
I just feel so selfish. For being scared, for feeling like I don't want this to happen.
Even though I know, deep down, this is what I truly want.
Phew! Wow... uh.
That was... a lot to get out all at once.
Felt good. Felt... needed.
But that's enough sentimental garbage for one night, yeah?
Thanks for listening, @. I mean it.
You've been... you've been good.
Think I'll call it here, though. It's late. You should probably also get to bed soon, too.
You gotta get up early, dontcha?
Thanks again, really.
Oh, Calvin, there you are.
Elliott? What brings you out here? And at this hour of all times.
Well, nothing like a nice nighttime walk, yes?
Ahem, well. In truth, I was looking for you.
(Oh boy). Oh yeah? What for?
I wanted to apologize for my past transgressions with you. We did not start out on the best of terms, but I remained petty, and that was unprofessional of me.
Oh, um. I'm sorry too.
I... cefinitely could've handled that better. It's just...
The things you said about Cetus really got under my skin.
And you were right to be frustrated. My draft may have been ruined, but I, as the senior gentleman, should've taken it with more responsibility.
And for what it is worth, I am sorry for what I said about your friend.
Cetus is his name, yes? He truly is a marvel.
He sure is something, isn't he? He'd be flattered.
I'm sure.
So, does this mean we can start over, from scratch?
Of course! After all, starting over from scratch often leads to the best results.
Just looking at my newest draft, it's the best it's ever been!
Really? I'm glad to hear it. And that you were able to get some good out of a bad situation.
Indeed! In fact, you should give it a read sometime.
Oh, well-- ya know what? Yeah. I'd love to.
Splendid!
Oh dear, time does fly, doesn't it?
Sure does. That's why I'm surprised you're all the way out here.
True, I should probably get going.
And isn't it past your bed time, too?
Har har, very funny.
Good night, Elliott.
Good night, Calvin.
